name: Aly
specialties: Oracle Fusion Cloud Integrations (ERP, HCM, EPM)

education.degree: Honours Bachelor of Science in Computer Science (Specialist in Statistical Machine Learning and Data Science, Co-op)

work_experience.title: Business Technology Analyst | Applications Developer
responsibilities: Operated in a client-facing consulting role, collaborating with stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions, present findings, clarify scope, and support delivery across multiple external client projects.

Designed and implemented data models across all C#-based integrations to support efficient ingestion, transformation, validation, and interaction with REST and SOAP APIs, resulting in scalable and reusable architectures.

Developed and deployed multiple Oracle Time and Labour integrations using C# .NET Core Azure Functions, REST APIs, and SOAP APIs to automate processing of 30,000+ time entries from systems such as Trapeze and Microsoft Shifts into Oracle Fusion HCM, with built-in exception reporting and failure handling.

Built an automated .NET Core (C#) integration to process SAP files and generate HDL batches, submitting and polling process status through REST APIs for pending worker creation and retrieving results via BIP reports using SOAP APIs.

Developed and deployed 5+ C# .NET Core integrations in Azure DevOps as Azure Functions, implementing robust ETL pipelines synchronizing data between cloud SaaS platforms and Oracle Fusion across ERP and HCM modules.
Collaborated on the completion of 4 outbound integrations from Oracle Fusion HCM to external systems including Trapeze, SAP, JD Edwards, and a Telus Abilities Management SFTP server.

Resolved critical bugs across an Oracle-based web application built using Oracle Visual Builder, fixing JavaScript UI logic, OIC middleware issues, and database stored procedures in Oracle ATP to restore core functionality and data integrity.
Created a C# .NET Core desktop data conversion application for Oracle modules, automating validation and REST API uploading of client data across ERP and HCM.

Developed 10+ GPU-accelerated Python automation scripts using Polars and NVIDIA RAPIDS for large-scale data validation and transformation, generating JSON payloads for high-throughput Oracle REST API uploads.
Enhanced an RFP-scraping Python bot with Selenium, Playwright, and BeautifulSoup to improve scraping reliability, dynamic content handling, and stakeholder notification accuracy.
Built SQL-based reporting solutions intersecting multiple Oracle Fusion ERP/HCM subject areas including Personnel, Compensation, Assignments, and Payroll.
Worked in Agile teams, attending sprint planning, daily standups, and code reviews, while maintaining documentation of integrations and test plans.

work_experience.title: Data Scientist (CO-OP)
responsibilities: Developed Python automation scripts to manipulate and transform supply chain data, generating actionable Excel reports and reducing manual reporting effort from 3–4 hours to under 20 minutes daily.
Built Power BI dashboards to provide insights to senior management and improve operational decision-making.
Consolidated large datasets to support reporting automation, cost savings, and optimized resource allocation.

work_experience.title: Data Scientist (CO-OP)
responsibilities: Developed Python ETL scripts consolidating 100+ supply chain data files for inventory and operations dashboards.
Built Power BI dashboards and capacity visualizations to improve workload distribution and staffing efficiency.

work_experience.company: Ontario Ministry of Government and Consumer Services
work_experience.title: Applications Programmer & Analyst (CO-OP)
responsibilities: Developed client-facing and stakeholder-facing web application features using TypeScript, Java, and SQL based on user requirements.
Implemented SQL queries and stored procedures to support backend operations and in-app data visualization for decision-making.

projects.name: Helpdesk Triage Agent
projects.description: FastAPI service combining a PyTorch sentiment classifier (DistilBERT SST-2) with LangGraph and LangChain for automated ticket triage, supporting CUDA/MPS/CPU with GPU half-precision inference.

projects.name: Flagging Loans Project
projects.description: Built a predictive model for loan risk assessment using Python, Scikit-learn, Pandas, and NumPy, achieving strong accuracy on imbalanced datasets.

projects.name: Top 1500 Steam Games Analysis
projects.description: Analyzed Steam’s top 1500 games by revenue; implemented a Gradient Boosting Regressor to predict game prices with 78% accuracy.

projects.name: Age Related Risk Analysis of COVID-19 Outcomes
projects.description: Used R Markdown, logistic regression, and bootstrap tests to analyze age-dependent COVID-19 mortality risks, validated with k-fold cross-validation.
